newsitem.title: UK: NWE high sulphur fuel cargoes slip in weak market.
newsitem.headline: NWE high sulphur fuel cargoes slip in weak market.

text.p: NWE high sulphur fuel oil prices slid on Friday as the product lost some of the value gained from a mid-week swaps and futures rally, traders said.

High sulphur cargoes lost $4 as fundamentals reasserted themselves. Good supply of material and weak end-user demand pushed offer levels down to $84 cif with the notional bid level at around $81-$82. But no trades were heard done.
Three big sellers of high sulphur were reported to have cargoes on offer for early April dates.
High sulphur barges lost $2 to trade in a narrow $88-$89 fob ARA range.
Healthy bunker demand helped prices stabilise later. One trade was done at $86.50 in Rotterdam.
"It was for a very prompt parcel and was not in line with what the market has been doing," said one trader
Low sulphur cargoes prices were held back by weakness in straight-run, where two refineries this week dumped product at low values to free up storage space.

"Straight-run is keeping the lid on low sulphur in the north and crude's down again which will not help cracked to recover," said a European trader. There was little interest in low sulphur and no business was heard done.
